title.rendered: Civil society accountability toolkit – Trinidad and Tobago

content.rendered:
What is the aim of the toolkit?
Civil Society Accountability: Principles and Practice is a toolkit developed by the FundFinity Grants and the Trinidad and Tobago Transparency Institute. It explores what accountability means for civil society organisations and provides
suggestions on how to put accountability into practice. The aims of the toolkit are threefold:

  1. To identify common principles of accountability for CSOs in Trinidad and Tobago;
  2. To highlight how CSOs currently demonstrate good accountability practice and also provide good practice standards;
  3. To provide practical steps, tools and frameworks that CSOs can use to realise accountability in their day-to-day activities and interactions with stakeholders.

excerpt.rendered: This toolkit explores what accountability means for civil society organisations in Trinidad and Tobago and provides suggestions on how to put accountability into practice. The toolkit was developed by the FundFinity Grants and the Trinidad and Tobago Transparency Institute.
